element.name: Gish Warrior
element.prerequisite: The ability to cast at least one spell

description.p: In battle, you entwine spellcasting and weapon fighting, granting you the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase one Ability Score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the Sorcerer spell list.

If you take the attack action, you can cast a cantrip with the casting time of 1 action as a bonus action that turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
If you cast a spell using an action, you can make a single weapon attack as a bonus action that turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: Learn one sorcerer cantrip. • If you take the Attack action, you can cast a cantrip as a bonus action. • If you cast a spell as an action, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

description.p: Your body is unique attuned to magic, granting you the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase one Ability Score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.
When you fail a saving throw against a spell, you can use a reaction to roll 1d4 and add the result to that save, potentially turning a failure into a success.
When a spell attack roll hits you, you can use a reaction to roll 1d6 and add the result to your AC for that attack, potentially causing that attack to miss.
You gain 1d6 temporary hit points when you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher with the range of self.

sheet.description: • Reaction: When you fail a spell save, add 1d4 to the roll. • Reaction: When hit by a spell attack, add 1d6 to your AC for that attack. • When you cast a 1st-level+ spell with range Self, gain 1d6 temp HP.

description.p: You are a master of flight, granting you the following benefits.

ul.li: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Increase your flying speed by 10 feet.
While flying, ranged attack rolls against you can’t have advantage.

While flying, you can take the Dodge or Dash actions as a bonus action. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, regaining all expended uses upon finishing a long rest.

sheet.description: +10ft flying speed. While flying, ranged attacks against you can't have advantage. While flying, you can Dodge or Dash as a bonus action.

description.p: In your capable hands, the simple Sling is a terrifying and lethal weapon. Your mastery grants you the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Attacking at long range with a Sling doesn’t impose disadvantage on your attack rolls.
Attacking a prone creature at range with a Sling doesn’t impose disadvantage on your attack rolls.

Once per turn, when you roll maximum damage on an attack made against a creature using a Sling, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your Proficiency Bonus) or fall prone.

sheet.description: No disadvantage at long range or vs. prone creatures with a sling. Once per turn, if you roll max damage with a sling, the target must make a DC {{sling master:dc}} Con save or fall prone.

description.p: You have mastered the whip, granting you the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
The damage die of the whip increases from 1d4 to 1d6 when you attack with it.

Once per turn, when you damage a creature with an attack roll using a whip, you can also attempt to strike another creature within your reach as part of that same attack. If your initial attack roll is sufficient to hit the second target, it takes damage equal to half the damage dealt to the initial target.

Once per turn, when you hit a creature that is no more than one size category larger than you with an attack using a whip, you can forgo dealing damage to instead knock that creature prone or pull it up to 10 feet closer to you.

sheet.description: Whip damage becomes 1d6. Once per turn, when you hit with a whip, you can also hit a second creature in reach if the attack roll is high enough. It takes half the damage. Once per turn, when you hit a creature no more than one size larger, you can forgo damage to knock it prone or pull it 10ft.

description.p: You are an expert in the subtle and deadly art of applying poison to blowgun ammunition, granting you the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You ignore the loading property of the blowgun.
You gain proficiency with the Poisoner’s Kit.

As a bonus action, you can coat a number of blowgun darts equal to your Dexterity modifier in a simple poison. The poison remains potent for 1 minute once applied, or until it strikes a creature. When you hit a creature with a poisoned dart, the target takes an additional 1d6 poison damage. If you score a critical hit with a poisoned dart, the target is also blinded until the end of its next turn.

sheet.description: Ignore loading property of blowguns. As a bonus action, coat up to {{dexterity:modifier}} darts with poison for 1 min. A hit deals +1d6 poison damage. A crit also blinds the target until the end of its next turn.

description.p: As an action, or as a reaction when hit by an attack, you can shrink yourself and everything you are currently wearing or carrying to 1/4 size. Your size category is reduced by 2 (to a minimum of Tiny), your AC increases by 2 (potentially turning a hit into a miss), you have disadvantage on Strength (Athletics) checks and Strength saving throws, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics and Stealth) checks and Dexterity saving throws.

This transformation lasts for 1 minute, or until you lose concentration (as if concentrating on a spell), at which time you revert to normal size. If there isn’t room for you to return to your normal size, you are shunted directly to the nearest unoccupied space where there is room for you to revert, taking 1d10 bludgeoning damage for every 5 feet you are shunted.

sheet.description: Shrink to 1/4 size for 1 min (conc.): • Size reduced by 2 categories (min Tiny). • Gain +2 AC • Disadv. on Str checks/saves • Adv. on Dex checks/saves Revert if conc. is lost. Take 1d10 bludgeoning per 5ft shunted if no room to revert.
